channel.title: Ban of trolls
channel.description: http://games.yahoo.com/blogs/plugged-in/arizona-bill-could-criminalize-internet-trolling-184547052.html OMG... Moparscape would have been completely banned (OOPS I didnt realize I was in the server downloads section...Thanks David)

item.title: Ban of trolls
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

t4:

assuming this passes, which i really doubt it will, what happens in the troll lives outside of AZ - does he get extradited? What about if he/she lives outside of the US?

The normal practice is that it need to be illegal in both the states. So if you troll in AZ and flee to NY, you wouldn’t get extradited except if NY get the same law.

Read full topic

item.title: Ban of trolls
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:38, topic:438398”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=541116.msg3964331#msg3964331 date=1333570190]

I live in Arizona and it’s not surprising a bill like this would pop up. Arizona is flooded with mormons and tons of idiots. It’s not gonna work anyway.

“mormon comes to door”
“answers the door unknowingly”
“hey brah you know john smith”
“facepalms and says brb getting shotgun”
“comes back to see morman wearing a troll mask”

LOLOL

I actually had a Jehovah witness come to the door the other day and when I closed the door on him, he stuck his foot in the door to stop me from closing it and then continued to talk.
Pretty off topic, but jus made me think wtf?
[/quote]that’s when you fire the shotgun[/quote]
LOLOL.
I can see them squirming and flapping off like blind pigeons in the mist…

Read full topic

they did.

she was too nice to tell them no.

she said in the living room and spoke with them for 2 hours(: proudest moment of my life.
